Description: Rim and neck sherd (mended from three fragments) of Laconian black-glazed pottery krater; interior glazed dull black; exterior: glazed black on top of rim; creamy slip on exterior surface of rim, with painted decoration consisting of paired hook maeander pattern between rows of dots; neck glazed.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1888,0601.649.a. For parallels, see Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA197. See also the pseudo-volute krater in the Musée Calvet in Avignon (S70) and another in the Museo Paolo Orsi, Syracuse 26749, in Stibbe 'Laconian Mixing Bowls', (1989), pl. 5, no. 2-3. Stibbe places this sherd in the Group with hook maeander of his Group E, the group of kraters with geometric rim ornaments only (Stibbe, 1989, 35).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 562, no. E45)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 23)
Stibbe 1989 / Laconian Mixing Bowls. A history of the Krater Lakonikos from the 7th to the 5th century BC (p. 104)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.49) (phase 3)
